instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-000165 not turning on
threads.message: Hi guys I have an 00165 that came in with a tiny bit of corrosion on <CAPACITOR>C7615</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R7611</RESISTOR>, replaced them. Also customer broke the battery connector, so replaced that as well. Now the mac gets an orange line, fan starts to spin, all voltages come up for DRAM and also CPU Vcore 1.2v, 1.3v and 1.8v, then after a few seconds it shuts down. I do get a ALL [U]SYS[/U]PWRGD signal as well at 3.2v. Could this be ROM related, or when the fan starts to spin it means not a ROM issue? I also have clock signal for the cpu present and USB mouse activity, until it shuts down. Any ideas? Board looks very clean.

threads.title: 820-000165 not turning on
threads.message:
Try first starting in SMC bypass.
Next, try known good clean ME BIOS.

threads.title: 820-000165 not turning on
threads.message: Found the issue, some corrosion on <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> reballed it and working again. Thanks!
